member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.Common.PrimaryBasedLogViewAdaptor`3
member.summary:
A general template for constructing log view adaptors that are based on a sequentially read and written primary. We use this to construct a variety of different log-consistency providers, all following the same basic pattern (read and write latest view from/to primary, and send notifications after writing).
Note that the log itself is transient, i.e. not actually saved to storage - only the latest view and some metadata (the log position, and write flags) is stored in the primary. It is safe to interleave calls to this adaptor (using grain scheduler only, of course).
Subclasses override ReadAsync and WriteAsync to read from / write to primary. Calls to the primary are serialized, i.e. never interleave.
member.typeparam: The user-defined view of the log
The type of the log entries
The type of submission entries stored in pending queue

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.Common.PrimaryBasedLogViewAdaptor`3.InitializeConfirmedView(`0)
member.summary: Set confirmed view the initial value (a view of the empty log)

member.summary: Read cached global state.

member.summary: Read version of cached global state.

member.summary: The storage interface exposed by grains that want to use the CustomStorage log-consistency provider The type for the state of the grain. The type for delta objects that represent updates to the state.

member.summary: Reads the current state and version from storage (note that the state object may be mutated by the provider, so it must not be shared).

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.CustomStorage.ICustomStorageInterface`2.ApplyUpdatesToStorage(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{`1},System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies the given array of deltas to storage, and returns true, if the version in storage matches the expected version. Otherwise, does nothing and returns false. If successful, the version of storage must be increased by the number of deltas.
member.returns: true if the deltas were applied, false otherwise

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.CustomStorage.LogConsistencyProvider
member.summary: A log-consistency provider that relies on grain-specific custom code for reading states from storage, and appending deltas to storage. Grains that wish to use this provider must implement the interface, to define how state is read and how deltas are written. If the provider attribute "PrimaryCluster" is supplied in the provider configuration, then only the specified cluster accesses storage, and other clusters may not issue updates.

member.name: P:Orleans.EventSourcing.CustomStorage.LogConsistencyProvider.PrimaryCluster
member.summary: Specifies a clusterid of the primary cluster from which to access storage exclusively, null if storage should be accessed directly from all clusters.

member.summary: A log consistency adaptor that uses the user-provided storage interface . This interface must be implemented by any grain that uses this log view adaptor.

member.summary: Gets the current confirmed state. Includes only confirmed events.

member.summary:
Called whenever the tentative state may have changed due to local or remote events.
Override this to react to changes of the state.

member.summary: Gets the current tentative state. Includes both confirmed and unconfirmed events.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.OnStateChanged
member.summary:
Called after the confirmed state may have changed (i.e. the confirmed version number is larger).
Override this to react to changes of the confirmed state.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.ConfirmEvents
member.summary:
Waits until all previously raised events have been confirmed.
await this after raising one or more events, to ensure events are persisted before proceeding, or to guarantee strong consistency (linearizability) even if there are multiple instances of this grain
member.returns: a task that completes once the events have been confirmed.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.RefreshNow
member.summary:
Retrieves the latest state now, and confirms all previously raised events. Effectively, this enforces synchronization with the global state.
Await this before reading the state to ensure strong consistency (linearizability) even if there are multiple instances of this grain
member.returns: a task that completes once the log has been refreshed and the events have been confirmed.

member.name: P:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.UnconfirmedEvents
member.summary: Returns the current queue of unconfirmed events.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.OnActivateAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: By default, upon activation, the journaled grain waits until it has loaded the latest view from storage. Subclasses can override this behavior, and skip the wait if desired.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.RetrieveConfirmedEvents(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a segment of the confirmed event sequence, possibly from storage. Throws if the events are not available to read. Whether events are available, and for how long, depends on the providers used and how they are configured.
member.param: the position of the event sequence from which to start
the position of the event sequence on which to end
member.returns: a task which returns the sequence of events between the two versions

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.OnConnectionIssue(Orleans.EventSourcing.ConnectionIssue)
member.summary:
Called when the underlying persistence or replication protocol is running into some sort of connection trouble.
Override this to monitor the health of the log-consistency protocol and/or to customize retry delays. Any exceptions thrown are caught and logged by the .
member.returns: The time to wait before retrying

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.JournaledGrain`2.OnConnectionIssueResolved(Orleans.EventSourcing.ConnectionIssue)
member.summary:
Called when a previously reported connection issue has been resolved.
Override this to monitor the health of the log-consistency protocol. Any exceptions thrown are caught and logged by the .

member.summary:
Defines how to apply events to the state. Unless it is overridden in the subclass, it calls a dynamic "Apply" function on the state, with the event as a parameter. All exceptions thrown by this method are caught and logged by the log view provider.
Override this to customize how to transition the state for a given event.
member.param: The state.
The event.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewUpdate`1.TryAppendRange(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Try to append a range of log entries atomically at the current position of the log.
member.returns: true if the entries were appended successfully, or false if there was a concurrency conflict (i.e. some other entries were previously appended).

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewUpdate`1.ConfirmSubmittedEntries
member.summary:
Confirm all submitted entries.
Waits until all previously submitted entries appear in the confirmed prefix of the log.
member.returns: A task that completes after all entries are confirmed.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewUpdate`1.Synchronize
member.summary:
Get the latest log view and confirm all submitted entries.
Waits until all previously submitted entries appear in the confirmed prefix of the log, and forces a refresh of the confirmed prefix.
member.returns: A task that completes after getting the latest version and confirming all entries.

member.summary: Interface to be implemented for a log-view adaptor factory

member.summary: Construct a to be installed in the given host grain.

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewAdaptorHost`2
member.summary: Interface implemented by all grains which use log-view consistency It gives the log view adaptor access to grain-specific information and callbacks.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewAdaptorHost`2.UpdateView(`0,`1)
member.summary: Implementation of view transitions. Any exceptions thrown will be caught and logged as a warning./>.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewAdaptorHost`2.OnViewChanged(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notifies the host grain about state changes. Called by whenever the tentative or confirmed state changes. Implementations may vary as to whether and how much they batch change notifications. Any exceptions thrown will be caught and logged as a warning./>.

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogConsistencyProtocolParticipant
member.summary: Grain interface for grains that participate in multi-cluster log-consistency protocols.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogConsistencyProtocolParticipant.PreActivateProtocolParticipant
member.summary: Called immediately before the user-level OnActivateAsync, on same scheduler.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogConsistencyProtocolParticipant.PostActivateProtocolParticipant
member.summary: Called immediately after the user-level OnActivateAsync, on same scheduler.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogConsistencyProtocolParticipant.DeactivateProtocolParticipant
member.summary: Called immediately after the user-level OnDeactivateAsync, on same scheduler.

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogConsistencyProtocolMessage
member.summary: interface to mark classes that represent protocol messages. All such classes must be serializable.

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogConsistentGrain`1
member.summary: Base class for all grains that use log-consistency for managing the state. It is the equivalent of for grains using log-consistency. (SiloAssemblyLoader uses it to extract type)

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogConsistentGrain`1.InstallAdaptor(Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewAdaptorFactory,System.Object,System.String,Orleans.Storage.IGrainStorage,Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogConsistencyProtocolServices)
member.summary: called right after grain construction to install the log view adaptor
member.param: The adaptor factory to use
The initial state of the view
The type name of the grain
The grain storage, if needed
Protocol services

member.name: P:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogConsistentGrain`1.DefaultAdaptorFactory
member.summary: Gets the default adaptor factory to use, or null if there is no default (in which case user MUST configure a consistency provider)

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogConsistencyProvider
member.summary:
A log-consistency provider that stores the latest view in primary storage, using any standard storage provider. Supports multiple clusters connecting to the same primary storage (doing optimistic concurrency control via e-tags)
The log itself is transient, i.e. not actually saved to storage - only the latest view (snapshot) and some metadata (the log position, and write flags) are stored in the primary.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogConsistencyProvider.MakeLogViewAdaptor``2(Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogViewAdaptorHost{``0,``1},``0,System.String,Orleans.Storage.IGrainStorage,Orleans.EventSourcing.ILogConsistencyProtocolServices)
member.summary: Make log view adaptor
member.typeparam: The type of the log entries
member.param: The grain that is hosting this adaptor
The initial state for this view
The type name of the grain
Storage provider
Runtime services for multi-cluster coherence protocols

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogStateWithMetaData`1
member.summary: A class that extends grain state with versioning metadata, so that a log-consistent grain can use a standard storage provider via

member.name: P:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogStateWithMetaData`1.Log
member.summary: The stored view of the log

member.name: P:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogStateWithMetaData`1.GlobalVersion
member.summary: The length of the log

member.name: P:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogStateWithMetaData`1.WriteVector
member.summary: Metadata that is used to avoid duplicate appends. Logically, this is a (string->bit) map, the keys being replica ids But this map is represented compactly as a simple string to reduce serialization/deserialization overhead Bits are read by and flipped by . Bits are toggled when writing, so that the retry logic can avoid appending an entry twice when retrying a failed append.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogStateWithMetaData`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogStateWithMetaData`1.GetBit(System.String)
member.summary: Gets one of the bits in
member.param: The replica for which we want to look up the bit

member.name: M:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogStateWithMetaData`1.FlipBit(System.String)
member.summary: toggle one of the bits in and return the new value.
member.param: The replica for which we want to flip the bit
member.returns: the state of the bit after flipping it

member.name: T:Orleans.EventSourcing.LogStorage.LogViewAdaptor`2
member.summary:
A log view adaptor that wraps around a traditional storage adaptor, and uses batching and e-tags to append entries.
The log itself is transient, i.e. not actually saved to storage - only the latest view and some metadata (the log position, and write flags) are stored.

member.summary: Initialize a StorageProviderLogViewAdaptor class

member.summary: Describes a connection issue that occurred when reading from the primary storage.

member.name: T:Orleans.Runtime.LogConsistency.ProtocolServices
member.summary: Functionality for use by log view adaptors that run distributed protocols. This class allows access to these services to providers that cannot see runtime-internals. It also stores grain-specific information like the grain reference, and caches
